clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Dramatization Simulation on Nursing Students' Ethical Attitudes
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dramatization Simulation on Nursing Students' Ethical Attitudes: A Mixed Method Research

brief_summary.textblock: Nursing students face many ethical problems in their clinical practice. It is very likely that they will encounter ethical problems after graduation. For this reason, students should be given an ethical attitude before graduating. It is very difficult to gain an ethical attitude. Ethical issues, on the other hand, are very difficult to gain as they are a limited concept. Therefore, different methods should be used in teaching. Dramatization simulation is one of the teaching methods used recently. It is especially effective in making abstract concepts that are difficult to understand concrete. It is thought that students participating in a dramatized simulation will be effective in gaining ethical attitudes by recognizing ethical problems more easily. This research will be carried out to determine the effect of dramatization simulation on the ethical attitudes of nursing students.

detailed_description.textblock: The effect of dramatization simulation on the ethical attitudes of nursing students will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.description: Ethical attitudes of nursing students will be determined by using the ethical principles attitude scale.

arm_group.description: In-class case studies will be conducted.
Case studies will be done in the form of dramatization simulation.

intervention.description: Ethical attitudes of nursing students will be evaluated with dramatization simulation application.
In-class case studies will be conducted with the control group students.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
* Students who agreed to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not participating in dramatization simulation applications,
- Not participating in classroom ethical case studies
